lines.text: I run out of that building and I see... the sky. I see all the things I love in this world. The work, the food, the time to sit and smoke. And I look at this pen and I ask myself, "What the hell am I grabbing this thing for? Why am I trying to become something I don't wanna become when all I want is out there waiting for me the minute I say I know who I am?"

[to his father]
Will you let me go, for Christ's sake? Will you take that phony dream and burn it before something happens?
Attention must be finally paid to such a person.

[to Willy's grave]
Willy, dear, I can't cry. Why did you do it? I search and search and I search, and I can't understand it, Willy. I made the last payment on the house today. Today, dear. And there'll be nobody home.

[arguing with Willy]
Pop, I'm a dime a dozen and so are you...

[shouting]
I am not a dime a dozen! I'm Willy Loman and you are Biff Loman!
